Title: Minimizing IoT Energy Consumption by IRS-Aided UAV Mobile Edge Computing
Abstract: in this letter we design new methods for jointly optimizing the reflection coefficients of intelligent reflecting surfaces  irss  and path selection in an unmanned aerial vehicle  uav  assisted mobile edge computing  mec  system that serves internet of things  iot  devices. a general mathematical formulation is presented for the problem of minimizing the total energy consumption of the system. furthermore the problem is solved for two cases namely when all irs elements have the same or different reflection coefficients. numerical results highlight the benefits of allowing the uav to choose between locally processing tasks and relaying them to the ground mec server.
